name: unpackerr
description: Unpackerr is a self-hosted daemon that monitors Sonarr, Radarr, and similar apps and automatically extracts completed downloads. It runs unattended and integrates into existing media automation setups.
features: Automatic extraction: Extract compressed downloads automatically when Sonarr or Radarr mark them complete.
Multi-app support: Monitor Sonarr, Radarr, Lidarr, Readarr, and Whisparr simultaneously.
Archive formats: Support RAR, ZIP, 7z, and other common archive formats for extraction.
Background operation: Run as a daemon in the background without user intervention.
Cleanup: Optionally delete archive files after successful extraction to save disk space.
Event monitoring: Watch for download completion events via API integration with Arr apps.
Parallel extraction: Extract multiple archives simultaneously for faster processing.
Error handling: Retry failed extractions and log errors for troubleshooting.
Password support: Extract password-protected archives when passwords are provided.
Path mapping: Handle different path structures between download client and media server.
Notification support: Send notifications when extractions complete or fail.
Lightweight: Run efficiently with minimal CPU and memory usage for continuous operation.
